description: The following is a general procedure guide for preparation and staining of acetone-fixed frozen tissues using a purified, unconjugated primary antibody, biotinylated secondary antibody and streptavidin-horseradish peroxidase (Sav-HRP) and DAB detection system. Because each antigen differs in terms of requirement for fixation, amplification step, etc., it is not possible to write an inclusive protocol that will work for all antigens. The user must determine optimal conditions for each antigen of interest. Many protocols for staining individual antigens, as well as useful tips and troubleshooting guides for immunohistochemistry, can be found at the IHC World web site (http://www.ihcworld.com/).
warning: Caution: DAB is a suspected carcinogen. Handle with care. Wear gloves, lab coat andeye protection.

components.data: Fix the tissue sections with a suitable fixative. One of the commonly used fixation methods for frozen tissue sections is to immerse the slides in pre-cooled acetone (-20°C) for 10 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fix the tissue sections with a suitable fixative. One of the commonly used fixation methods for frozen tissue sections is to immerse the slides in pre-cooled acetone (-20°C) for 10 min.

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Place a freshly dissected tissue block (<5 mm thick) on to a pre-labeled tissue base mold.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place a freshly dissected tissue block (<5 mm thick) on to a pre-labeled tissue base mold.

components.data: Prepare frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Cover the entire tissue block with cryo-embedding media (e.g. OCT).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover the entire tissue block with cryo-embedding media (e.g. OCT).

components.data: Prepare frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Slowly place the base mold containing the tissue block into liquid nitrogen till the entiretissue block is submerged into liquid nitrogen to ensure tissue is frozen completely.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Slowly place the base mold containing the tissue block into liquid nitrogen till the entiretissue block is submerged into liquid nitrogen to ensure tissue is frozen completely.

components.data: Prepare frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Store the frozen tissue block at -80°C until ready for sectioning.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store the frozen tissue block at -80°C until ready for sectioning.

components.data: Prepare frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Transfer the frozen tissue block to a cryotome cryostat (e.g. -20°C) prior to sectioning and allow the temperature of the frozen tissue block to equilibrate to the temperature of the cryotome cryostat.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the frozen tissue block to a cryotome cryostat (e.g. -20°C) prior to sectioning and allow the temperature of the frozen tissue block to equilibrate to the temperature of the cryotome cryostat.

components.data: Prepare frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Section the frozen tissue block into a desired thickness (typically 5-10 µm) using the cryotome.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Section the frozen tissue block into a desired thickness (typically 5-10 µm) using the cryotome.

components.data: Prepare frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tissue sections onto glass slides suitable for immunohistochemistry (e.g. Superfrost).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tissue sections onto glass slides suitable for immunohistochemistry (e.g. Superfrost).

components.data: Prepare frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Dry the tissue sections overnight at room temperature. Sections can be stored in a sealed slide box at -80°C for later use.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry the tissue sections overnight at room temperature. Sections can be stored in a sealed slide box at -80°C for later use.

components.data: Prepare frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Pour off the fixative and allow acetone to evaporate from the tissue sections for ≥ 20  min at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour off the fixative and allow acetone to evaporate from the tissue sections for ≥ 20  min at room temperature.

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Rinse the slides in 300 ml of 10 mM phosphate buffered saline (PBS) at a neutral pH for 5 min (1/2).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse the slides in 300 ml of 10 mM phosphate buffered saline (PBS) at a neutral pH for 5 min (1/2).

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 11 of Immunohistochemistry Protocol for Frozen Sections

components.data: Incubate the slides in 0.3% H2O2 solution in PBS at room temperature for 10 min to block endogenous peroxidase activity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the slides in 0.3% H2O2 solution in PBS at room temperature for 10 min to block endogenous peroxidase activity.

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Rinse the slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min (1/2).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse the slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min (1/2).

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: (optional) Add 100 µl blocking buffer (e.g. 10% fetal bovine serum in PBS) onto the sections of the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber at room temperature for 1h.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: (optional) Add 100 µl blocking buffer (e.g. 10% fetal bovine serum in PBS) onto the sections of the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber at room temperature for 1h.

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Drain off the blocking buffer from the slides.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Drain off the blocking buffer from the slides.

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Apply 100 µl an appropriately diluted primary antibody (in antibody dilution buffer,e.g. 0.5% bovine serum albumin in PBS) to the sections on the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber for 1 h at room temperature or overnight at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply 100 µl an appropriately diluted primary antibody (in antibody dilution buffer,e.g. 0.5% bovine serum albumin in PBS) to the sections on the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber for 1 h at room temperature or overnight at 4°C.

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Rinse the slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min (1/2).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse the slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min (1/2).

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Apply 100 µl an appropriately diluted biotinylated secondary antibody (using the antibodydilution buffer) to the sections on the slides and incubate in a humidified chamberat room temperature for 30 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply 100 µl an appropriately diluted biotinylated secondary antibody (using the antibodydilution buffer) to the sections on the slides and incubate in a humidified chamberat room temperature for 30 min.

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections

components.data: Rinse the slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min (1/2).

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Rinse the slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min (1/2).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse the slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min (1/2).

components.data: Immunostain frozen tissue sections
components.name: Section

components.data: Apply 100 µl DAB substrate solution (freshly made just before use: 0.05% DAB - 0.015%H2O2 in PBS) to the sections on the slides to reveal the color of the antibody staining. Allow the color development for ≤ 5 min until the desired color intensity is reached.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply 100 µl DAB substrate solution (freshly made just before use: 0.05% DAB - 0.015%H2O2 in PBS) to the sections on the slides to reveal the color of the antibody staining. Allow the color development for ≤ 5 min until the desired color intensity is reached.

source_data.annotation: Dehydrate the tissue slides through a total of 4 changes of alcohol (95%, 95%, 100% and 100%), 5 min each.

components.name: Description
